senses.de: No longer having; lacking or without.

Tips.title: Indicating Lack
Tips.description: Use 'out of' to show something is missing or depleted.
Tips.example: We're out of sugar. Can you buy some?

Tips.title: Indicating State/Condition
Tips.description: Use 'out of' to describe a particular state or condition.
Tips.example: The elevator is out of order.

Tips.title: Indicating Source/Origin
Tips.description: Use 'out of' to show the source or origin of something.
Tips.example: He made a dress out of old curtains.

lacking.wordDefinition: 'Lacking' implies a general absence, while 'out of' suggests a specific depletion or unavailability.

without.wordDefinition: 'Without' is more general and can be used in a broader range of situations. 'Out of' is more specific to situations of depletion or unavailability.
